wikipedia_page.main: Sir William Robert Campion,  (3 July 1870 – 2 January 1951) was a British soldier, politician, and the 21st Governor of Western Australia from 1924 to 1931.

response: *1951 – William Campion, English colonel and politician, 21st Governor of Western Australia (b. 1870)
| Colonel Sir William Campion KCMG DSO TD

The Cenotaph was unveiled in the year of the Centenary of Western Australia – on 24 November 1929 by the Governor Sir William Campion, and had as the honorary architect General Sir J. Talbot Hobbs.Item 12 in Memorials and Memories – Kings Park and Botanic Garden Botanic Gardens and Parks Authority The court of contemplation is at the western side of the precinct and was unveiled on 6 November 1955 by Sir Charles Gairdner. The flame of remembrance and pool of reflection was inaugurated by Queen Elizabeth II on 1 April 2000.Items 14 and 16 in Memorials and Memories – Kings Park and Botanic Garden Botanic Gardens and Parks Authority
*Governor of Western Australia – Sir Francis Newdegate (until 16 June), then Sir William Campion

In the 1929 centenary of Western Australia one of the events in the city of Perth was the placing of a commemorative plaque in the northwest corner of the building by the Governor Sir William Campion.
*Governor of Western Australia – Sir William Campion
